column7: emergency dental care and extractions in an annual amount of not more than $1
column8: 000 per member.  When treated at an Indian Health Service or Tribal Facility
column9: adult dental services that are eligible for a federal medical assistance percentage of 100% in excess of the limit prescribed."

column6: "The results of background checks for each adult member of the foster care placement household will be used to determine danger level.  Foster children shall be kept safe from placements that constitute a Tier 5 danger. If the department determines that a placement constitutes a tier 5 danger
column7: the department shall remove all foster children from this placement within four(24)  hours after making the determination."

column5: "Establish state-wide standards for drinking water pollutants"
column6: "Primary drinking water maximum contaminant levels established by the administrator before August 13
column7: 1986 are adopted as drinking water aquifer water quality standards. The administrator may adopt additional primary drinking water maximum contaminant levels
column8: unless \"substantial opposition\" are received during the first year of review."

column5: "Financial literacy training qualifies as a work activity"
column6: "As a condition of eligibility for unemployment insurance cash assistance
column7: all recipients shall engage in work activities.  The department may allow a course in financial literacy and personal finance to qualify as a work activity.  These may include instruction on household cash management techniques
column9: obtaining and using term and term credit or securing a loan or other term financing arrangements for high-cost items."
